TNM_staging.definition: Carcinoma in situ; cancer cells are present but have not invaded nearby tissues.
Early-stage cancer; tumor is small and localized, with no lymph node involvement or distant metastasis.
Locally advanced cancer; tumor is larger or involves nearby lymph nodes but has not spread to distant sites.
Locally advanced cancer; tumor is large, involves nearby lymph nodes, and may have spread to adjacent tissues.
Metastatic cancer; cancer has spread to distant organs or tissues.
